description: Access designs, export assets, and interact with Figma files through Claude
author: Figma
content: Connect Claude to Figma Desktop for design operations, asset extraction, and design system management.
features: Access and browse Figma designs in real-time
Export assets in various formats (PNG, SVG, PDF)
Navigate through pages and frames programmatically
Extract text content and style information

steps: Ensure Figma Desktop is running with Dev Mode MCP Server enabled
Add the Figma server configuration pointing to local port

installation.claudeCode: claude mcp add --transport http figma-dev-mode-mcp-server http://127.0.0.1:3845/mcp

useCases: Export design assets for development implementation
security: Only works with local Figma Desktop instance
Requires appropriate file permissions in Figma
No external API keys or authentication needed

troubleshooting.issue: Invalid sessionId error from MCP endpoint
troubleshooting.solution: Change transport type from sse to http in MCP config. Remove old config: claude mcp remove figma-dev-mode-mcp-server, then re-add with http transport at http://127.0.0.1:3845/mcp.

troubleshooting.issue: HTTP 404 error: MCP server not responding
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure Figma Desktop app is running and Dev Mode MCP Server is active. Check Figma preferences to verify MCP Server is enabled. Restart Figma Desktop if server doesn't appear.

troubleshooting.issue: Connection failed: invalid request body error
troubleshooting.solution: Verify you're using http transport, not sse. Update config URL to http://127.0.0.1:3845/mcp. Check request format matches MCP protocol specification for initialize request.

troubleshooting.issue: Cannot access assets - 404 on asset requests
troubleshooting.solution: MCP Server can't serve assets directly from browser. Access assets through Claude Code or configured MCP client. Verify file is open in Figma Desktop and permissions allow export.

troubleshooting.issue: WSL users cannot connect to local MCP server
troubleshooting.solution: Figma MCP binds only to 127.0.0.1 which WSL can't access. Use Windows-native Claude Code installation or configure port forwarding from WSL to Windows host for 127.0.0.1:3845.
